data: PED NEPH Hemodialysis Confirmed Bacteremia Treatment
Patient Care
Gram negative bacteremia is not typically catheter related and will need to rule out source
For Catheter Removal Recommendations, refer to Confirmed Hemodialysis Catheter-Related Bacteremia Treatment Algorithm
Medications
HD Associated Gram Negative Bacteremia
Re-evaluate cultures and sensitivites within 48 hours of positive culture
cefTAZidime
50 mg/kg, IV, qMonWedFri, order duration: 2 week
For penicillin or cephalosporin allergy (eg anaphylaxis), select gentamicin
gentamicin
2 mg/kg, IV, qMonWedFri, order duration: 2 week
HD Catheter-related Bacteremia Staph Aureus (CONFIRMED)
For methicillin sensitive staphylococcus aureus infections order cloxacillin (inpatient only) OR ceFAZolin

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
ceFAZolin
25 mg/kg, IV, qdaily, order duration: 3 week
If MRSA or cefazolin allergic/contraindicated, select vancomycin
vancomycin
15 mg/kg, IV, qMonWedFri, order duration: 3 week
HD Catheter-related Bacteremia Coag neg Staph or Strep viridans (CONFIRMED)
For methicillin sensitive organism select ceFAZolin
ceFAZolin
25 mg/kg, IV, qdaily, order duration: 2 week
For methicillin-resistant organism  or cephalosporin allergy (e.g. anaphylaxis), select vancomycin
vancomycin
15 mg/kg, IV, qMonWedFri, order duration: 2 week
Laboratory
Pediatric Blood Culture Request (CWH)
Blood, hemodialysis catheter, Routine, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, qdaily
Pediatric Blood Culture
Blood, hemodialysis catheter, Routine, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, qdaily
Blood Culture Pediatric
Blood, hemodialysis catheter, Routine, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, qdaily
gentamicin Trough Draw Instructions
Draw level pre-dialysis. Refer to drug dosing handbook for therapeutic drug monitoring guidance
vancomycin Trough Draw Instructions
Draw level pre-dialysis. Refer to drug dosing handbook for therapeutic drug monitoring guidance
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - One Time
If/when one week after cessation of antibiotics, then order pediatric blood culture
Diagnostic Tests
EC Echocardiogram
Routine, Reason: Other (Must Specify), Additional Reason: rule out endocarditis
CARD Echo
Routine, Schedule as: Outpatient, Primary Indication: Other (please specify), Special Instructions: rule out endocarditis
Consults/Referrals
If require gentamicin long term, then consult audiology
Referral to Clinic Not Using CST Cerner
Within 72 hours, Paper Referral, Audiogram for gentamicin therapy
